line_1: One fatal rock on which good authors split
line_2: Is thinking all mankind must have their wit;

line_1: And Grace and Virtue, Sense and Reason split,
line_2: With all the rash dexterity of Wit.

line_1: Has pointed out the rocks where others split:
line_2: Thus far my zeal, tho' for the task unfit,

line_1: Should we avoid on this dread rock to split,
line_2: Then — free from folly, the true point to hit,

line_1: Should we avoid on this dread rock to split,
line_2: Moliere instructs us with his comic wit.

line_1: And breath'd an idle wish to split
line_2: In twain her beauty, years, and wit —
